thread.title: Orange Is The New Black's Laverne Cox scores Rocky Horror lead
thread.title_full: Orange Is The New Black's Laverne Cox scores Rocky Horror lead

author: canberratimes.com.au
title: Orange Is The New Black's Laverne Cox scores Rocky Horror lead
text:
Click to play video Return to video Video settings Please Log in to update your video settings

Laverne Cox is a feminist In this vision from August 2014, transgender actress Laverne Cox discusses different forms of feminism and her own association with the cause.
PT0M58S http://www.canberratimes.com.au/action/externalEmbeddedPlayer?id=d-450fh 620 349 October 23, 2015 - 9:17AM Autoplay On Off Video feedback Video settings Orange Is The New Black's  Laverne Cox is to play Frank-N-Furter in an upcoming two-hour TV production of the 1975 cult classic Rocky Horror Picture Show .
I am so excited to be a part of #RockHorror legacy. #DontDreamItBeIt https://t.co/tzCOpz5NFC 
â€” Laverne Cox (@Lavernecox) October 21, 2015 Cox, who has received an Emmy nomination for her role as transgender inmate Sophia Burset in Netflix's OITNB, is the first trans woman of colour to have a leading role on a mainstream scripted TV show.
Jump to the left ... Laverne Cox will play Frank-N-Furter in Fox's new production. Photo: Facebook 
The casting adds weight to Fox's commitment to the project, which has been in development but whose future was considered dependent on casting.
Advertisement The lead role of the "sweet transvestite from transsexual Transylvania" was played by Tim Curry in a scene-stealing performance in the original film.
According to Fox, the new Rocky Horror "follows sweethearts Janet Weiss and Brad Majors, who stumble upon Dr. Frank-N-Furter's bizarre abode. Frank-N-Furter, a sexually ambiguous flirtatious alien mad-scientist, is holding an annual, Transylvanian science convention to showcase the birth of 'Rocky Horror' - a fit, attractive man created solely to fulfil Frank's desires."
Rocky road ... Tim Curry as the original Frank-N-Furter. 
Susan Sarandon and Barry Bostwick played Janet and Brad, respectively, in the 1975 film.
Cox also plays the lead in a CBS pilot, Doubt . Her documentary, Laverne Cox Presents: The T Word , won a Daytime Emmy Award and was nominated for a GLAAD Media Award. Her next trans-themed documentary, Free CeCe , is scheduled for release in next year.
Kenny Ortega ( High School Musical, Newsies ) will direct, choreograph and serve as executive producer of the new production.
USA Today
